about.content:
I am currently working at Square Enix Montréal as a Unity Gameplay Programmer.

I have a deep interest in anything programming related about video game development.
I am deeply passionate and polyvalent and always looking to learn new ways of doing things or new technologies.
Users oriented, I do my best to create complete and fun experiences.

sheikah-runes.title: Zelda Botw Sheikah Runes
sheikah-runes.sub-title: Recreation of the four Sheikah Runes in the Unreal Engine 4.
sheikah-runes.tags: Gameplay mechanics - Zelda BOTW - Unreal Engine

modal.body:
During the lockdown, I started to learn the Unreal Engine to create small games and prototypes.
At the end of summer, I challenged myself to make a bigger project and recreate the four Sheikah Runes abilities from The Legend of Zelda Breath of the Wild.

The project features :

  • Four distinct Sheikah Runes (Remote Bombs, Cryonis, Stasis, Magnesis) working gameplay mechanics.
  • Complete User Interface working like the full game for each rune.
  • Basic melee combo system for interacting with stasis objects.
  • A demo level in the form of a Shrine, where you can test the abilities in four rooms and collect orbs.
  • Basic animations and VFX made by a programmer.

Before working on the actual project, I rewrote the asset Advanced Locomotion System V4 to learn and understand the Animation Blueprint system.
For this project, I used for the first time visual scripting to create all the gameplay mechanics as I was very curious to compare it with classic code. In the end, I think I still prefer the old way, I find it more productive and easier to track changes.

See more and download the project on Github

insanity-brush.title: insanity brush
insanity-brush.sub-title: little arcade game about painting with psychedelic effects.
insanity-brush.tags: Arcade Game - Game Jam - 48h deadline - Unity - C#

modal.body:
insanity brush is a small arcade game where the player must clean the maximum of painting spots before going crazy by their smell in a close painting room.

The game was created in 48h in part of the GMTKJam with the theme Out of Control.
I was in charge of all the technical aspects of the game including character movement and logic; UI animations and transitions; attack patterns; etc...
The game includes a tutorial section with dialogues for a complete experience.
We also did all the art for the game, it was quite a challenge to create, rig and animate 3D models at it's was our first time doing it.

Credits :

  • Baptiste REY, programmer
  • Paul REY, game artist

See more and download on itch.io

the-last-frame.title: The Last Frame
the-last-frame.sub-title: Cooperative puzzle game with an asymmetric gameplay with spooky vibes!
the-last-frame.tags: Coop - Puzzle - Asymmetrical - Unity - Ubisoft Game Lab Competition

modal.body:
Steph, a young adult, returns to her family's mansion looking for what she believes is the family's treasure, but all is not the way she remembered. It seems she will not be alone in her quest to find her family's legacy...

The Last Frame is a cooperative puzzle game with an asymmetric gameplay. It was created as part of the Ubisoft Game Lab Competition, an annual competition organised by Ubisoft challenging students in groups of 8 to create a game in 10 weeks, with several constraints to fulfil.

Sadly, due to covid-19 complications, the Ubisoft Game Lab Competition was cancelled on March 16, only 9 days before it was due. We decided to carry on nonetheless and finish our game.

The team :

  • Victor Delenclos
  • Laura Bouzeraud
  • Baptiste Rey
  • Clément Ramat
  • Elie Ensuque
  • Clémence Petit
  • Raphaëlle Garcia
  • Dorian Antoinet

See the trailer on Youtube

See more and download on itch.io

city-wheel.title: City Wheel
city-wheel.sub-title: Race game in a wheelchair and a city full of obstacles.

modal.body:
City-Wheel is a serious game in which you control a delivery guy in a wheelchair and travel through town to complete several quests.
While designing the game, we wanted to to make the player understand the struggles a person in a wheelchair can face in public spaces and how he can change his behaviour to facilitate the movement of disabled persons.

The team :

  • Benjamin Perez
  • Baptiste Rey
  • Pierre Patard
  • Jérôme Désoutter
  • Vincent Varlet

I developed and design all the UI of the game (dialogue system, animations, layout, navigation indications...).
I also helped the team with the core architecture of the game, introducing them with the approach of Ryan Hipple in his GDC talk, Game Architecture with Scriptable Object. This approach consists of using Scriptable Objects to make a game more Modular (less inter-dependency), more Editable (focus on data) and more Debuggable (easy to isolate components).

Made with Unity in C#.

See the gameplay video on Youtube

See more and download on itch.io

bounty-island.title: Bounty Island!
bounty-island.sub-title: Couch versus game about digging chests.
bounty-island.tags: Local Multi-player - Pirates - Unity - C# - Game Jam

modal.body:
Bounty Island! is a fun local multi-player game (2 to 4 players) where the goal is to dig and bring back as many chests possible to your team's base. But beware, because you can also dig up bombs!
You can also steal the other team's chests, hit them with your shovel to make them drop their chests, throw the bombs at them before they explode and push your enemies into the water.

The game was made in 72h for a game jam around the theme "Bounty".

The team :

  • Victor Delenclos
  • Laura Bouzeraud
  • Baptiste Rey
  • Clément Ramat
  • Elie Ensuque
  • Clémence Petit
  • Raphaëlle Garcia

My contribution includes developing core mechanics (movements, interaction system) and debugging.
As I was the most experienced with Unity in the team, I helped the other members on their functionalities and managed the project in a coherent whole.

Made with Unity in C#.

See the gameplay video on Youtube

See more and download on itch.io

chicken-panic.title: Chicken Panic! 🦜
chicken-panic.sub-title: Couch versus game with pirates and chickens!

modal.body:
Chicken Panic! is a couch co-op and versus game where two teams of two players compete to be last crew standing by shooting chickens through cannons.

I worked on the programming and game designing part.

As I was far away from my brother when we worked on the game, I decided to define explicitly the management of the project using an agile approach with weekly meetings and objectives.
I must say this approach worked pretty well because even if we did not have a lot of time to dedicate to the project every week, the agile method kept us motivated and, and in the end, helpt us deliver a complete game.

This was a personal project with Paul Rey (game artist).

Made with Unity in C#.

See the trailer on Youtube

See more and download on itch.io

keep-your-head-above-water.title: Keep your head above water
keep-your-head-above-water.sub-title: Climb for your life by cooperating or betraying! ⚔️
keep-your-head-above-water.tags: Game Jam - Local Multi-player - Unity - C#

modal.body:
Keep Your Head Above Water is couch cooperative and competitive game where players compete to be the first one climbing the building before dying of toxic waters.
The game features power-ups, interactive doors and a fishing rod that can be used to catch other players.

The game was made in 48h for the autumn WonderJam 2019 at the UQAC with the theme "Climate catastrophe in 2119".

The team :

  • Axel Bertrand
  • Laura Bouzeraud
  • Baptiste Rey
  • Bertrand Gilbert-Collet
  • Benjamin Perez
  • Clément Cariou

My contribution includes developing core mechanics (jumping, fishing rode, power-ups, players HUD) and debugging.
As I was the most experienced with Unity in the team, I helped the other members on their functionalities and managed the project in a coherent whole.

See the gameplay video on Youtube

See more and download on itch.io

infinite-torpor.title: Infinite Torpor
infinite-torpor.sub-title: Dungeon Crawler made from scratch in C++ using SDL.

modal.body:
Explore procedurally generated dungeons, fight back and try to find a way out!

This was a personal project I started because I wanted to improve my C++ skills in a bigger project that the ones I did in school.

I built the game engine from scratch using an ECS approach (game loop, collisions detection, buttons, animations...), and developed game mechanics (combat system, enemies behaviors, A* pathfinding...).
The game is procedurally generated based on hand-crafted rooms.

Made in C++ with only SDL2.

See the source code on Github

Art by calciumtrice

this-is-the-life.title: TL; DR: This is the life
this-is-the-life.sub-title: Game jam submission made in 72h with Unity.

modal.body:
Control your claw as the baby Grim Reaper and try to catch as many tiny humans as you can !
Be careful, this is not a easy task!

This was a personal project with my little brother Paul Rey (game artist).

I worked on the programming and game designing part.

For this Game Jam we wanted to build a finished game right away. We took some times to find a simple idea that kept the scope of the game low. That allowed us to add music, particle effects, tutorial, multiple feed-backs and an high-score system that help deliver a simple but complete experience to the player.

Made with Unity in C# in 72h for the GDL - July Jam.

PLAY on itch.io

Download the game for Android

MagicLess is a 2D pixel-art Metroidvania with strong and unique enemies, exploration, NPC dialogues, quests and even one boss (hooray 🎉)!

This was a personal project with Paul Rey (game artist).

It was my first game made with Unity and I worked on the programming and game designing part.
When we started the project, we made the mistake to set the scope of the game too high so in the end, we did not finish it.
But the game still has a lot of contents and can be played until a final boss.

This project made me learn a lot of Unity, including sprite animations; scenes loading; character movements; states machines; local saves based on serialization; particle effects; lights...

Made with Unity in C#.

See the trailer on Youtube

See more and PLAY on itch.io

crazy-eights.title: Crazy Eights!
crazy-eights.tags: School Project - Java - GUI - Multiple Threads

modal.body:
Play the famous Crazy Eights game against a computer!
You can play with a GUI or a command line interface and even both at the same time.
You can even play with different rules.

This was a school project with a team of 2 people.

The code uses the MVC pattern and is object-oriented.
In order to run the concurrent interfaces, the game uses multiple threads.

Made in Java and Swing for the GUI.

See the source code on Github

fight-for-fight.title: Fight for... FIGHT!
fight-for-fight.sub-title: Made in 48h with Pygame for a school game jam.
fight-for-fight.tags: School Project - Game Jam - Python - Pygame

modal.body:
Play with up to four friends and compete against each other in this couch versus game! Summons powerful and unique arrows, dodge projectiles with your dash and be the last one alive!

You can even create your own arenas!

It was a school project with a team of 5 people.

I managed the project by ensuring that every member worked on something different in a coherent whole. I also worked on the core-engine of the game and the main menu.
We designed the classes in an object-oriented way.

Made in Python and with Pygame in 72h for a school game jam.

See the trailer on Youtube

See the source code on Github

monopoly.title: Monopoly
monopoly.sub-title: Recreated the famous board game in Java

modal.body:
Destroy friendship while playing Monopoly against your friends!
All the mechanics of the original game are included.

It was a school project with a team of 3 people.

The code uses the MVC pattern and is object-oriented.

Made in Java and Swing for the GUI.

For my portfolio, I chose to make it myself with Angular because I like the framework and wanted to experiment with the animation system.

I designed the website and made most of the HTML and CSS using flexbox for its awesome layout system.
The website is fully responsive and works on desktops, phones and tablets.

After some failures with the native animations system, I finally used angular-animations. This library is very great and works very well with the Angular's eco-system.

To trigger the animations at the right time, I initially did it via Javascript but I wasn't satisfied with the result.
I ended up using the Intersection Observer API via a custom directive.

jsjs.title: JeSaisJeSais
jsjs.sub-title: Platform for consulting and creating online courses with serious games mechanics

modal.body:
I worked on JeSaisJeSais as intern Full-Stack developer for 6 months.
JeSaisJeSais is an online platform that allows users to create and consult courses enhanced with serious games mechanics.

My main goals were to maintain and extend the current Back-End code using Django and to implement new Front-End functionalities and visuals (both desktop and mobile) with Angular 2+.

Key features I worked on :

  • Dialogue activity, user can interact with NPC and get a score based on his answers.
  • Dialogue editor with a custom node-based system.
  • Quiz activity and editor that handle text, images, videos and embedded contents.
  • Multimedia library for importing custom content that can be used in activities.
  • The shopping cart and the payment system using the Braintree API for transactions.
  • And more!

As the team was small, I was greatly involved in the development process, working closely with the designer and artist as well at the other developers when making core decisions.

You can visit the site here.

Filmder is an application for both Android and iOS that allows users to find easily movies to watch.

Key features :

  • Save or discard movies by swapping right or left
  • Discover movies based on custom search criteria.
  • Get a quick overview of movies by showing users score, director, casting and more.
  • Keep track of movies to watch and movies watched.

This was a school project made by Nicolas Guevara and me.

We developed two versions of the app, using Android Studio for the Android version and xCode for the iOS version.

Finally, we used the The Movie DB API to populate the app with movies.

eol.title: Elixir Of Love
eol.sub-title: Top-down action game with crafting and magic.
eol.tags: AI - Behavior Tree - Unity - C# - School Project

modal.body:
Elixir of Love is a top-down action game where players explore dungeons and craft powerful potions!
The game features a crafting system, multiple magic spells, multiple enemies with unique behaviours and one boss to fight.

The game is a school project made at the UQAC using an agile approach. We also wrote a Game Design Document before the actual development.

The team :

  • Baptiste Rey
  • Jean Farines
  • Maëva Trivino
  • Damien Galochet

I worked on core mechanics of the game, including :

  • Player movement and combat system.
  • Enemies' behaviour using Final State Machines and a Behaviour Tree for the boss.
  • Inventory system using Scriptable Objects.
  • Simple crafting system.

Made with Unity in C#.
